p:
Naturopathic doctors act in pediatric care in both primary and consultative roles. NDs are trained to promote and monitor healthy growth and development, educate families on preventative strategies, address risk factors for disease, and manage childhood illnesses. As all primary care providers do, NDs may play a number of roles in the care of children:
Wellness promotion
Prevention of disease
Surveillance and screening for developmental delay or disease
Management of acute and chronic illness
Coordination of care
Advocacy for a healthy community and environment
